page.title: 15FARMER'S POOR YEAR "1985"
page.content: FARMERS IN THE KILMARNOCK AREA HAVE BEEN BADLY HIT BY THE WETTEST SUMMER IN LIVING MEMORY WHICH HAS LEFT FIELDS AND PASTURE LAND VERY WET AND MUDDY. MANY GRASS TYPE CROPS HAVE BEEN DECIMATED,KNOCKED OVER BY HEAVY RAIN THE CROPS HAVE NOT RECOVERED. MANY LOCAL FARMERS FACE GREAT PROBLEMS ESPECIALLY IN TRYING TO FEED THEIR DAIRY HERDS DURING THE WINTER. MOST AREAS' SILAGE CROP HAS BEEN CUT, BUT BECAUSE OF CONTINUAL RAIN IT HAS NOT DRIED AND IS THEREFORE NO USE AS WINTER FEED. FARMERS MAY BE FORCED TO IMPORT LARGE QUANTITIES OF FEED OR SLAUGHTER THEIR HERDS.
